title: Simona Necidová
text:
Simona Necidová (born 20 January 1994) is a Czech <a href="Association%20football">football</a> <a href="Defender%20%28association%20football%29">defender</a> who plays for <a href="Czech%20First%20Division%20%28women%29">Czech First Division</a> club <a href="FC%20Slovan%20Liberec%20%28women%29">Liberec</a> on loan from <a href="SK%20Slavia%20Praha%20%28women%29">Slavia Prague</a> and the <a href="Czech%20Republic%20women%27s%20national%20football%20team">Czech Republic national team</a>. Her elder brother <a href="Tom%C3%A1%C5%A1%20Necid">Tomáš Necid</a> is also an international footballer.
Club career.
Necidová joined Slavia Prague in 2007 and broke into the first team during the 2011–12 season. In the <a href="2015%E2%80%9316%20UEFA%20Women%27s%20Champions%20League">2015–16 UEFA Women's Champions League</a>, she scored the winning goal in Slavia's <a href="2015%E2%80%9316%20UEFA%20Women%27s%20Champions%20League%20knockout%20phase%23Slavia%20Praha%20v%20Zvezda%20Perm">2–1 win over Zvezda Perm</a> which qualified her team for the quarter-final.
International career.
At the <a href="2016%20Cyprus%20Cup">2016 Cyprus Cup</a> Necidová scored a late goal against <a href="Wales%20women%27s%20national%20football%20team">Wales</a> to secure a 1–0 win for the Czech Republic.
